intro: Viola punctata, commonly known as the spotted violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and violet flowers with distinctive black spots. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this species thrives in woodland and grassland habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and blooms in spring. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
